text.p: Romanian footballer Adrian Ilie has signed a three-and-a-half year contract to join compatriots Georghe Hagi and Iulian Filipescu at Istanbul club Galatasaray, Anatolian news agency said on Monday.
Under the deal the Turkish club will pay Ilie's old club, Steaua Bucharest, a $2.8 million transfer fee, while the the player will receive a further $800,000.
"I came here to play football and win the championship with my friends. Together with Hagi and Filipescu we can achive every kind of success," Ilie told reporters.
Galatasaray are currently top of the Turkish league but were knocked out of the second round of the European Cup Winners' Cup by Paris Saint-Germain.
